content: this gorgeous and simple baby blanket can be the perfect choice if you love colors and easy repetitive row i used this stitch combination in my waves of nature tote bag 1 and i thought you would love a blanket option too **it can be made in any size ** make a baby blanket or if you are more adventurous crochet a large afghan the pattern is **free on my blog here 2 ** or if you click on visit pattern website above also you can dowload an ad free pdf version from my ravelry store for a small fee **special thanks to my testers ** *cheryl freeman kerry freeman michelle schneider* **difficulty ** advanced beginner **size ** 86 cm x 117 cm / 34 x 46 after blocking **materials needed ** 4 mm and 5 mm * g and h * size hooks * i used limited edition bloodwood+white swirl alpha by furls * **note if you crochet loosely i advise you to use a smaller size hook** **scheepjes colour crafter** in the following shades and quantities heerlen-1432 c1 55 g 165 m/181 yards amersfoort-1390 c2 55 g 165 m/181 yards sittard-1130 c3 55 g 165 m/181 yards lelystad-1026 c4 55 g 165 m/181 yards leien-1020 c5 55 g 165 m/181 yards almelo-1316 c6 55 g 165 m/181 yards urk-1034 c7 55 g 165 m/181 yards barneveld-1005 c8 80 g 240 m/263 yards **total 465 g** **total yardage approx 1395 metres/ 1530 yards** yarn needle for weaving in ends scissors stitch markers * optional * **us terms** used throughout it is available to download as a **photo tutorial** and it has a **print friendly version** too also there are several links to my **support videos on youtube** to show you how to make some specific stitches **no chart/diagram available ** i hope you ll love it as much as i loved creating it ***happy crocheting *** *krisztina* 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/waves-of-nature-tote-bag 2 https //kamecrochet com/2023/02/11/alima-blanket/
